title: Mixing imperative and reactive datasource does not work
body:
### Describe the bug

Hi!

In my project I would like to have an imperative PostgreSQL default datasource, and a named reactive PostgreSQL datasource, like this:

```
quarkus.datasource.db-kind=postgresql
quarkus.datasource.username=quarkus
quarkus.datasource.password=quarkus
quarkus.datasource.jdbc.url=jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/quarkus
quarkus.datasource.jdbc.initial-size=10
quarkus.datasource.jdbc.min-size=10
quarkus.datasource.jdbc.max-size=30
quarkus.datasource.min-size=10
quarkus.datasource.max-size=30

quarkus.datasource.react.db-kind=postgresql
quarkus.datasource.react.username=quarkus2
quarkus.datasource.react.password=quarkus2
quarkus.datasource.react.reactive.url=postgresql://localhost:5432/quarkus2
quarkus.datasource.react.reactive.max-size=30
```

I have imported both PG client in pom.xml

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
  <artifactId>quarkus-jdbc-postgresql</artifactId>
</dependency>
<dependency>
  <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
  <artifactId>quarkus-reactive-pg-client</artifactId>
</dependency>
```

I would like to inject the reactive datasource like this:

```
@Inject
@ReactiveDataSource("react")
io.vertx.mutiny.pgclient.PgPool client;
```


But when I starting the app, the following error message occurs: `quarkus.datasource.react.jdbc.url` has not been defined

I have no idea if this should work that way at all, but if so, unfortunately it doesnâ€™t work. Is there any workaround for this?

Thank you,
Viktor
